Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Tuesday September 8, 2015:Strategic Hotels & Resorts to be Acquired by Blackstone for $14.25/Share
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday September 8, 2015

Text: Strategic Hotels & Resorts, Inc. (NYSE: BEE) announced Tuesday, that it has entered into a definitive agreement with affiliates of Blackstone Real Estate Partners VIII L.P. (NYSE: BX), under which Blackstone will acquire all outstanding shares of common stock of Strategic Hotels & Resorts, Inc., for $14.25 per share in cash, and all of the outstanding membership units of the Company's subsidiary, Strategic Hotels Funding L.L.C., not held by the Company, for $14.25 per unit in cash. The transaction value is approximately $6 billion. The deal is expected to be completed by Q1 of 2016Strategic Hotels & Resorts closed at $14.07 on Tuesday, a gain of 3.5%. Microsoft Acquires Adallom
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday September 8, 2015

Text: Microsoft's (NASDAQ: MSFT) Corporate Vice President, Cloud and Enterprise Marketing, Takeshi Numoto, announced Tuesday, that Microsoft has acquired Adallom, an innovator in cloud security and a leader in helping customers protect their critical assets across cloud applications. Terms of the deal were not disclosed, but Bloomberg reported the purchase price was $250 millionMicrosoft closed at $43.89 Tuesday, up 3%.Mylan to Launch Offer for Perrigo Directly to Perrigo Shareholders on Sept. 14The Offer: Mylan N.V. (NYSE: MYL) announced Tuesday, its intent to commence a formal offer to exchange all outstanding ordinary shares of Perrigo Company plc (NYSE: PRGO) on September 14, 2015. Under the terms of the offer, Perrigo shareholders will receive $75 in cash and 2.3 Mylan ordinary shares for each Perrigo ordinary share. Mylan shareholders have voted overwhelmingly in favor of the transaction.Perrigo shares closed at $180.65 Tuesday, a gain of 1%.Deal Reporter Says Big Pharma to Offer $300/Share for BlueBird Bio
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday September 8, 2015

Text: Shares of BlueBird Bio (NASDAQ: BLUE) rose Tuesday, following a report from Deal Reporter that big pharma could pay up to $300 per share for the Cambridge-based biotech company. That report was based on a Life Sciences Report article dated September 2.BlueBird did not respond to a request for comment. BlueBird shares closed at $138.10 Tuesday, a gain of 6.79%.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday September 8, 2015

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Thursday September 3, 2015:AOL to Acquire Millenial Media for $1.75/Share

Text: AOL (NYSE: VZ) announced Thursday, it signed an agreement to acquire Millennial Media, Inc. The transaction is expected to close in the fall.Millenial Media closed at $1.74 Thursday, up 30%.Another Cisco for FireEye Rumor
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday September 3, 2015

Text: Shares of FireEye (NASDAQ: FEYE) rose Thursday, on renewed unconfirmed chatter of a potential bid by Cisco (NASDAQ: CSCO). The rumored purchase price is $60 per share.The two companies have been mentioned on multiple occasions as a potential pairing. Cisco CEO John Chambers dismissed a previous FireEye rumor, during an earnings call in May.Spokespersons for the companies did not respond to requests for comment.FireEye shares closed at $36.86 Thursday, a loss of $0.61.Microsoft Acquires Volometrix; Terms Not Disclosed
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday September 3, 2015

Text: Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) announced Thursday, that it has agreed to acquire organizational analytics comaony VoloMetrix. Terms were not disclosed.Microsoft shares closed at $43.50 Thursday, a gain of $0.14.Allergan Acquires Aquesys for $300M Upfront Payment
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday September 3, 2015

Text: Allergan plc (NYSE: AGN) and medical device company AqueSys, Inc. announced Thursday that they have entered into an agreement under which Allergan will acquire AqueSys in an all-cash transaction for a $300 million upfront payment. In addition, there will be commercialization milestone payments related to AqueSys' lead development programs, including XEN45.Allergan anticipates closing the transaction in Q4 of 2015.Allergan shares closed at $297.44 Thursday, down $2.17.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Wednesday September 2, 2015:Valeant Pharmaceuticals to Acquire Synergetics for $6.50/Share in Cash
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday September 2, 2015

Text: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, Inc. (NYSE: VRX) announced it will acquire Synergetics USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: SURG) for $6.50 per share in cash in an upfront payment. Additionally, Synergetics shareholders will receive additional cash payments of up to $1.00 per share if specified sales milestones are achieved following the closing. The transaction is expected to close in Q4 of 2015.Valeant closed at $232.18 on Wednesday, a gain of 3.5%. JBT to Acquire A&B Process Systems for $102M

(Rapac), following a publication in Israel's Globes, that it was informed by RR Media that RR Media was approached by an international corporation, mentioned by the publication as SES, with a non-binding preliminary indication of interest for the acquisition of RR Media. Text: Lannett Company, Inc. (NYSE: LCI) announced Wednesday, that it has signed a definitive agreement to purchase Kremers Urban Pharmaceuticals for $1.23 billion, plus potential contingency payments. Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 31, 2015

Text: Perrigo Company plc (NYSE: PRGO) announced Monday that it has acquired OTC scar management brand, ScarAway, from Enaltus, LLC. Terms were not disclosed. The brand is expected to generate approximately $3 million in sales for the remainder of 2015.Perrigo closed at $182.97 on Monday, a loss of 1.32%. HealthSouth Acquires CareSouth Home Health for $170M Cash
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 31, 2015

Text: HealthSouth Corporation (NYSE: HLS) announced Monday, its Encompass Home Health operating unit has agreed to acquire the home health agency operations of CareSouth Health System, Inc. for $170 million in cash. The transaction is expected to close in Q4 of 2015, HealthSouth closed at $42.70 Monday, down 1.5%.Amicus Therapeutics to Acquire Rare Disease Company for $229M in Cash, Stock
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 31, 2015

Text: Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ: FOLD) and privately-held Scioderm, Inc. announced Monday, that they have signed a definitive agreement under which Amicus will acquire 100% of the capital stock of Scioderm, Inc. for $229 million in cash and stock. Amicus will pay Scioderm shareholders $125 million in cash and $104 million in newly issued Amicus shares, plus up to an additional $361 million to Scioderm shareholders upon achievement of certain clinical and regulatory and $257 million to Scioderm shareholders in cash upon achievement of certain sales milestones. The deal is expected to close in Q3 of 2015.Amicus shares closed at $14.38 Monday, down 3.3%.Kang Announces Receipt of Preliminary Non-Binding "Going Private" ProposalThe Going Private Proposal:iKang Healthcare Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: KANG) announced Monday, that its board of directors has received a non-binding proposal letter, dated August 31, 2015, from Chairman and CEO Ligang Zhang and certain of his affiliated entities, and FV Investment Holdings, proposing a "going-private" transaction to acquire all of the outstanding Class A common shares and ADSs of the Company not already owned by the Buyer Group, for $17.80 per ADS in cash.The Board intends to form a special committee consisting of independent directors to consider this proposal.iKang shares closed at $15.72 Monday, a loss of 2%.Hearing Rumored Bids from Western Digital, Seagate for SanDisk
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 31, 2015

Text: Shares of SanDisk (NASDAQ: SNDK) rose Monday on unconfirmed market chatter, that the company has hired an advisor, following approaches from Western Digital (NASDAQ: WDC) and Seagate (NASDAQ: STX). The advisor is rumored to be Goldman Sachs.SanDisk declined comment on the rumor, while Western Digital and Seagate did not respond to requests for comment.SanDisk shares closed at $54.56 Monday, a gain of more than 4%.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Friday August 28 through Sunday August 30, 2015:China's Unigroup Chairman Meeting With Micron Board Members Regarding Bid
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: China's Tsinghua Unigroup chairman, Zhao Weiguo, has reportedly traveled to the United States to meet with Micron Technology (NASDAQ: MU) board members, to discuss a potential takeover bid, according to souces as reported by Reuters. Mr. Zhao is also attempting to deal with US national security concerns by meeting with experts in the field. Senator Schumer has called for the deal to be blocked, as Micron chips are used in U.S. weapons systems.Micron rejected a $23 billion offer in July from Tsinghua Unigroup.Representatives from Micron and Tsinghua did not immediately respond to requests for comment.Micron closed at $15.96 on Friday, a gain of almost 2%. Mylan Shareholders Approve Perrigo Proposed AcquisitionThe Shareholder Approval:Mylan N.V. (NYSE: MYL) announced Friday, that its shareholders approved the co's proposed acquisition of Perrigo Company plc (NYSE: PRGO). Two-thirds of the votes cast were in favor of the deal.Perrigo responded, stating they were confident that most shareholders believe Mylan's unsolicited offer substantially undervalues Perrigo and would reject the proposal.Perrigo 1.5% Friday, closing at $185.42. Mylan fell 2%, closing at $50.37.Investors May Slash $77/Share Qihoo 360 Bid
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: The group of investors who bid $77.00 per share for Qihoo 360 Technology in June, may cut its offer following the recent selloff in the Chinese stock market, according to sources, as reported by the Wall Street Journal. Qihoo 360 announced receipt of the preliminary non-binding $9 billion offer on Jun 17.Qihoo 360 said in June it had received a buyout offer from chief executive and some investors for $77.00 in cash per ADSQihoo 360 shares closed at $52.66 Friday, a up 2.5%. Shares had traded down 2.5% in the premarket.Ariad Said to be in Takeover Talks With Baxalta
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Shares of Ariad Pharmaceuticals Inc. (NASDAQ: ARIA) soared higher Friday, on a report from the Boston Globe that the biotech company was in talks to sell itself to Baxlata, Inc. (NYSE: BXLT), according to sources. An acqusition of Ariad and its leukemia drug Iclusing, is seen as an attempt for Baxalta to fight off a takeover by Shire PLC (NASDAQ: SHPG). Baxalta rejected a $45.23 per share all-stock offer from Shire on August 4, saying the proposal was "not a basis for further discussions."Aria shares closed at $9.89 Friday, a gain of more than 41% on 10 times average volume.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Wednesday August 26, 2015:Schlumberger to Acquire Cameron for $66.36/Share in Cash, Stock
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday August 26, 2015

Text: Schlumberger Limited (NYSE: SLB) and Cameron (NYSE: CAM) announced Wednesday, a definitive merger agreement in which the companies will combine in a stock and cash transaction, valued at 14.8 billion. Cameron shareholders will receive 0.716 shares of Schlumberger common stock and a cash payment of $14.44, valued at $66.36 per share.The deal is expected to close in Q1 of 2106. Cameron closed at $59.93 on Wednesday, up 41%. Schlumberger closed at $70.89, down more than 3%.Monsanto Withdraws Bid for SyngentaThe Withdrawn Offer:Monsanto Company (NYSE: MON) announced Wednesday, that is withdrawing its bid to acquire Syngenta (NYSE: SYN), after Syngenta communicated that Monsanto's enhanced proposal did not meet Syngenta's financial expectations. Monsanto confirmed that its new proposal increased the cash component of the proposed transaction to CHF 245 per share, with a total offer of CHF 470 per share.Syngenta's Board confirmed that it received a verbal proposal from Monsanto to acquire the company at a price of CHF 245 in cash and a fixed ratio of 2.229 Monsanto shares per Syngenta share. Syngenta's Board rejected the revised proposal, said it significantly undervalued the company and was fraught with execution risk. Syngenta fell 13.5% Wednesday, closing at $67.51.NQ Mobile Enters Into Binding Agreement to sell FL Mobile, NationSkyThe Deals:NQ Mobile Inc. (NYSE: NQ) announced Wednesday, it has entered into a legally binding framework agreement with Beijing Jinxing Rongda Investment Management Co. Ltd., a subsidiary of Tsinghua Holdings Co., Ltd and an independent third party, to sell the Company's entire stake in FL Mobile Inc., for no less than $626 million.NQ Mobile also announed it has entered into legally binding share purchase agreements, which provide for the sale of all of NQ Mobile's interest in the NationSky business to Mr. Hou Shuli, a founder and senior management member of Beijing NationSky, for an aggregate consideration of US $80 million cash.NQ shares closed at $3.03 Wednesday, and traded as high as $4.13 after-hours.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday August 26, 2015

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Tuesday August 25, 2015:D.C. Public Service Commission Votes Down Pepco-Excelon Merger
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday, August 25, 2015

Text: The Public Service Commission of the District of Columbia voted Tuesday, to deny an application for acquisition of Pepco Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: POM) by Exelon Corporation as not being in the public interest. Pepco and Exelon have 30 days to ask the Commission to reconsider its decision.Pepco and Excelon issued a joint statement: "We are disappointed with the Commission's decision and believe it fails to recognize the benefits of the merger to the District of Columbia and its residents and businesses. We continue to believe our proposal is in the public interest and provides direct immediate and long-term benefits to customers, enhances reliability and preserves our role as a community partner. We will review our options with respect to this decision and will respond once that process is complete." The merger application has been approved in Virginia, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland, and by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. Only the District of Columbia has denied the application. Pepco closed at $22.51 on Tuesday, down 16.5%. Excelon closed at $30.40, down almost 7%.Syngenta Investor Says Would Tender Shares at CHF 470/ShareThe Shareholder Comments:Guillaume Delorme, fund manager for Oddo Asset Management, which holds a 0.16% stake in Syngenta (NYSE: SYT), said Tuesday, 470 Swiss francs per share is a good price and we would tender our shares at this level, according to Reuters. On Monday, Bloomberg reported that Monsanto had increased its offer to acquire Syngenta from CHF 449 per share to CHF 470 per share, according to sources.Syngenta fell 4% Tuesday, closing at $78.09.Encana to Sell Its Haynesville Natural Gas Assets for $850M
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday, August 25, 2015

Text: Encana Corporation (NYSE: ECA) announced Monday, that its subsidiary, Encana Oil & Gas (USA) Inc., has reached an agreement to sell its Haynesville natural gas assets in northern Louisiana, to GEP Haynesville, LLC for $850 million in cash. The sale is expected to close in Q4 of 2015.Encana shares rose 2.74% Tuesday, closing at $5.99.Heartland Food Products to Acquire Splenda Brand from Johnson & Johnson
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday, August 25, 2015

Text: Heartland Food Products Group announced Tuesday, it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the Splenda low calorie sweetener brand from McNeil Nutritionals, LLC, a subsidiary of Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. (NYSE: JNJ). The financial terms of the transaction have not been disclosed.JNJ fell 2.25% Tuesday, closing at $90.73.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday, August 25, 2015

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Monday August 24, 2015:Xerox to Acquire RSA Medical
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 24, 2015

Text: Xerox (NYSE: XRX) announced Monday, an agreement to acquire RSA Medical. Terms were not disclosed.The transaction is expected to close in Q3 of 2015.Xerox closed at $9.93 on Monday, down 7%.Southern Company Acquires AGL Resources for ~$12B
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 24, 2015

Text: Southern Company (NYSE: SO) and AGL Resources (NYSE: GAS) announced Monday, that both companies' boards of directors approved a definitive merger agreement. AGL Resources will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Southern Company in a transaction with an enterprise value of approximately $12 billion, with a total equity value of approximately $8 billion. AGL Resources shareholders will receive $66 per share in cash.The deal is expected to close in H2 of 2016.AGL Resources closed Monday at $61.41 Monday, a gain of 28%.Medivation to Acquire Worldwide Rights to Talazoparib from BioMarin for $410M Upfront
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 24, 2015

Text: Medivation, Inc. (NASDAQ: MDVN) and BioMarin Pharmaceutical Inc. (NASDAQ: BMRN) announced Monday, that Medivation will acquire all worldwide rights to talazoparib, a highly-potent, orally-available poly ADP ribose polymerase inhibitor currently in a Phase 3 study for the treatment of patients with deleterious germline BRCA 1 or BRCA 2 mutations and locally advanced and/or metastatic breast cancer. Medivation will pay BioMarin $410 million upfront, up to an additional $160 million upon the achievement of regulatory and sales-based milestones and mid-single digit royalties for talazoparib.BioMarin shares fell 5% Monday, closing at $119.68.Monsanto Raises Offer for Syngenta to CHF470/Share, According to Sources
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 24, 2015

Text: Monsanto Co (NYSE: MON) has increased its offer to acquire Syngenta AG (NYSE: SYT) from CHF 449 per share to CHF 470 per share, according to sources as reported by Bloomberg on Monday. That would value Syngenta at $47 billion. The Wall Street Journal had reported earlier in the day that Syngenta's Board was under pressure to consider a Monsanto offer.A Syngenta representative did not immediately respond to a request for comment, A Monsanto representative declined comment.Syngenta rose 6% Monday, closing at $81.37.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday August 24, 2015

Vitol already owns 50% of VTTI BV, which will continue to be run as an independent, standalone company under CEO Rob Nijst.VTTI Energy Partners closed Friday at $20.52 Friday, a loss of almost 4%.TreeHouse Said to be in talks to Acquire ConAgra's Private-label Food Unit for ~$3B

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Thursday August 20, 2015:United Technologies is in Talks to Acquire Nortek, According to Sources
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday August 20, 2015

Text: Shares of Nortek Inc. (NYSE: NTK) spiked higher Thursday following a Wall Street Journal report that United Technologies Corporation (NYSE: UTX) was in talks to acquire the Providence, RI-based manufacturer of products for remodeling and replacement and residential and commercial new construction.Spokespersons for the companies did not respond to requests for comment.Nortek closed at $86.78 on Thursday, up 17%.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter Anadarko Petroleum has Hired Goldman Sachs After Being Approached by Exxon With $86/Share Offer
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday August 20, 2015

Text: Shares of Anadarko Petroleum Corporation (NYSE: APC) rose Thursday, on unconfirmed market chatter that the company has been approached by Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE: XOM) with an $86.00 per share offer. The Woodlands, TX-based oil & gas company is said to have hired Goldman Sachs as an advisor to assist in the sale process. In July, a similar rumor surfaced, with a potential offer of up to $90.00 per share.Anadarko closed at $71.05 Thursday, a loss of almost 2%.Oracle Acquires Maxymiser; Terms Not Disclosed
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday August 20, 2015

Text: Oracle (NYSE: ORCL) announced Thursday, that it has signed an agreement to acquire the provider of cloud-based software that enables marketers to test, target and personalize what a customer sees on a Web page or mobile app, Maxymiser. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.Oracle shares fell more than 2% Thursday, closing at $38.63.Solera Holdings Confirms It's Exploring Strategic Alternatives
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday August 20, 2015

Text: Solera Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: SLH) announced Thursday, that it is exploring a variety of strategic alternatives, confirming a Wednesday Bloomberg story. Solera's Board of Directors has formed a special committee, which has retained Centerview Partners LLC as its financial advisor and Sullivan & Cromwell as its legal advisor. Solera does not expect to make further public comment during the review process.Solera shares fell 3.72% Thursday, closing at $46.84.Valeant Pharmaceuticals to Acquire Sprout Pharmaceuticals for $1B Cash
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday August 20, 2015

Text: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, Inc. (NYSE: VRX) and Sprout Pharmaceuticals, Inc. announced Thursday, that they have entered into a definitive agreement under which a wholly-owned subsidiary of Valeant will acquire Sprout, on a debt-free basis, for approximately $1 billion in cash, plus a share of future profits based upon the achievement of certain milestones. Valeant will pay approximately $500 million at the closing of the transaction, an additional payment in the amount of $500 million, payable in Q1 of 2016, plus a share of future profits based upon the achievement of certain milestones.The acquisition of Sprout comes a day after the company received approval from the FDA on its NDA for flibanserin, its treatement for female sexual desire disorder. Flibanserin will be marketed as Addyi in the U.S. Valeant shares fell 6.55% Thursday, closing at $229.06Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Wednesday August 19, 2015:United Therapeutics to Sell Priority Review Voucher to AbbVie for $350M
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday August 19, 2015

Text: United Therapeutics Corporation (NASDAQ: UTHR) announced Wednesday that it has entered into an agreement to sell its Rare Pediatric Disease Priority Review Voucher to a subsidiary of AbbVie Inc. (NYSE: ABBV) for $350 million in cash. The voucher was awarded by the FDA under a provision that encourages development of new drugs and biologics for the prevention and treatment of rare pediatric diseases.United Therapeutics closed at $167.68 on Wednesday, up $0.10.'The Deal' Reports IBM, FireEye May Bid for CyberArk
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday August 19, 2015

Text: CyberArk (NYSE: CYBR) shares rose Wednesday on a report from The Deal that IBM (NYSE: IBM) and FireEye (NASDAQ: FEYE) could each look at CyberArk as a potential takeover target. FireEye has been mentioned as an acquisition target for IBM in the past.CyberArk closed at $61.63 Wednesday, a gain of 3.5%.Suja Juice Announces Minority Investment Deal With The Coca-Cola Company
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday August 19, 2015

Text: Suja Life LLC. announced Wednesday, an investment and distribution partnership with The Coca?Cola Company (NYSE: KO). Sujua says Coca-Cola's minority investment will increase the availability of Suja.The Merchant Banking Division of Goldman Sachs has also made a minority investment in Suja. Bloomberg reported that Coca-Cola is said to have option to acquire Suja as part of the deal.Coca-Cola shares fell 1.26% Wednesday, closing at $40.78.Solera Reportedly Exploring Sale
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday August 19, 2015

Text: Solera Holdings Inc. (NYSE: SLH) has attracted interest from private equity firms and is working with a financial advisor, according to sources as reported by Bloomberg on Wednesday. Solera is said to have approached Pamplona Capital Management and Thoma Bravo.A spokesperson for Thoma Bravo, declined comment. While Solera and Pamplona did not immediately respond to requests for comment, according to Bloomberg. Solera shares rose $0.15 Wednesday, closing at $48.65.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

Non-Binding Go Private Offer at $5.23/ADS in CashThe 'Going Private' Offer:Country Style Cooking Restaurant Chain Co., Ltd (NYSE: CCSC) announced Friday, that its Board of Directors has received a non-binding proposal letter, dated August 14, 2015, from Hong Li, Co-Founder and Chairwoman of the Board, Mr. Xingqiang Zhang, Co-Founder, CEO and Director of the Company, and Sky Success Venture Holdings Limited, proposing a "going-private" transaction to acquire all of the outstanding ordinary shares of the company not already owned by the potential buyers or their respective affiliates for $5.23 in cash per ADS.The Board has formed a special committee and authorized them to retain independent legal and financial advisors to assist in evaluating the proposal.Country Style Cooking shares rose 7% Friday, closing at $4.71.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Monday July 27, 2015:Teva to Acquire Allergan Generics for $40.5 Billion
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday July 27, 2015

Text: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd. (NYSE: TEVA) announced Monday, that it will acquire Allergan Generics (NYSE: AGN) for $40.5 billion. Upon closing, including $33.75 billion in cash and $6.75 billion in shares of Teva. The deal is expected to close in Q1 of 2016. Teva also announced that it has withdrawn its cash and stock proposal to acquire Mylan N.V. (NASDAQ: MYL) and won't pursue a transaction with Mylan at this time. Allergan CEO Brent Saunders said on the conference call that the company may use the cash from the Teva deal for M&A. Amgen Inc. (NASDAQ: AMGN) and AbbVie Inc. (NYSE: ABBV) are potential targets, according to Bloomberg.Teva closed at $72.00 on Monday, a gain of 16.5%. Allergan shares gained 6%, closing at $326.98.Xiamen Insight Investment Co to Acquire Xueda Education Group for $5.50/ADS

Text: The Match Group, a subsidiary of IAC/InterActiveCorp (NASDAQ: IACI), announced Tuesday that it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire dating site PlentyOfFish for $575 million in cash.The transaction is expected to close early in Q4.IAC shares rose more than 2% Tuesday, closing at 84.89.Twitter Shares Spike on Rumor from Fake 'Bloomberg' SiteThe Fake Rumor:Shares of Twitter (NYSE: TWTR) spiked higher Tuesday, on what first appeared to be a report from Bloomberg, that Twitter had received an offer of $31 billion. The story appeared on the website Bloomberg.Market, which after review, was determined by Benzinga to have been registered by a company out of either Panama or Peru, using the registrar Namecheap.com and was not registered to Bloomberg LP.Bloomberg LP later said the Twitter story was fake and Twitter denied reports of a potential deal.The registrar Namecheap.com told Benzinga they had no instructions to remove the domain or the website and said were out of the loop on this issue.Twitter shares, which spiked as high as $38.82 on the rumor, closed at $36.72, a gain of more than 2.5%.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. (NASDAQ: DEPO) for $29.25 in Horizon shares, or approximately $3.0 billion. EXOR Announces New Enhanced Terms for PartnerRe ShareholdersThe Enhanced Offer:EXOR S.p.A. (OTC: EXOSF), the largest shareholder of PartnerRe Ltd. (NYSE: PRE) held an investor meeting in New York City on Tuesday, for PartnerRe shareholders. EXOR Chairman and CEO John Elkann, announced further enhancements to its $137.50 per share all-cash offer: 1) EXOR will permit PartnerRe to actively solicit bids, share due diligence materials and negotiate with third parties until August 31, 2015, so that shareholders have assurance that the EXOR Binding Offer remains the superior alternative for the company. 2) PartnerRe and AXIS agreed to a termination and expense reimbursement fee of $315 million, worth $6.39 per share to PartnerRe shareholders. If both PartnerRe and AXIS shareholders vote down the PartnerRe/AXIS transaction, EXOR commits to pass the value on to PartnerRe shareholders in full, effectively increasing the value of its binding offer to $143.89 per share.Also included in the enhancements are a 100bps increase in the dividend rate, call protection for preferred shares until January 1 , 2021 and 5 years of capital distribution limits.PartnerRe shares rose $0.49 Tuesday, closing at $131.49EMC to Sell Syncplicity to SkyView Capital LLC

Text: Aetna (NYSE: AET) and Humana Inc. (NYSE: HUM) announced Friday, that Aetna will acquire all outstanding shares of Humana for $37 billion or approximately $230 in cash and stock, based on the closing price of Aetna common shares on July 2, 2015. K+S Board Rejects Potash OfferThe Rejection:K+S Aktiengesellschaft rejected Potash Corporation's (NYSE: POT) unsolicited takeover proposal of 41 per share in cash on Thursday. K+S said the offer does not reflect the fundamental value and is not in the best interest of the company. K+S said the proposal disregarded the value of its "Legacy" Canadian mining project.Potash responded on Friday, confirming that their proposal "is not predicated on closing mines, curtailing production, selling the salt business or cutting jobs." Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Wednesday July 1, 2015:ACE to Acquire Chubb for $28.3B in Cash, Stock
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday July 1, 2015

Text: ACE Limited (NYSE: ACE) and The Chubb Corporation (NYSE: CB) announced Wednesday, that the Boards of Directors of both companies have unanimously approved the acquisition by ACE of Chubb for $62.93 per share in cash and 0.6019 shares of ACE stock. The total value of the deal is $28.3 billion, or $124.13 per share, based on the closing price of ACE shares on June 30, 2015. ACE shareholders will own 70% of the combined company, and Chubb shareholders will own 30%. The transaction is expected to close during the first quarter of 2016,Chubb shares rose 26% Wednesday, closing at $119.99. Ace shares rose $0.81 to close at $102.49.Hearing Unconfirmed Chatter of Potential Exxon Mobil Bid for Anadarko

Anadarko Petroleum did not respond to a request for comment.Anadarko shares fell $0.88 Wednesday, closing at $77.18.Shaanxi J&R Fire Protection to Acquire 5.5% Stake in CNinsure for $37.36MThe Stake:CNinsure Inc. (NASDAQ: CISG) announced Wednesday that Shaanxi J&R Firefighting Inc. has entered into a share purchase agreement with Kingsford Resources Limited to acquire a 5.5% stake in CNinsure. J&R will purchase from Kingsford 63,320,000 ordinary shares of CNinsure, which is equal to 3,166,000 of CNinsure's ADSs, for a total purchase price of approximately $37.4 million in cash. The deal is expected to close within 60 days.CNinsure shares lost $0.04 Wednesday, closing at $8.79.PayPal tO Acquire Xoom for $25/Share in Cash
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday July 1, 2015

Text: PayPal, Inc. (NYSE: EBAY) and digital money transfer provider Xoom Corporation (NASDAQ: XOOM), announced Wednesday, a definitive agreement under which PayPal will acquire Xoom for $25 per share in cash, for an enterprise value of approximately $890 million. The deal is expected to close in Q4 of 2015.Xoom shares closed Wednesday at $20.70 and traded up 25% after-hours.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A After-Hours Center Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Pep Boys Board said the strategic review process was decided on following receipt of interest from third parties.A 2012 deal between Pep Boys and Gores Groups fell apart when Gores sought a delay due to Pep Boys cautious guidance. According to sources, a deal could be valued at close to $19 billion.Campbell Soup declined comment on the rumor.Campbell Soup shares gained 2% Tuesday, closing at $47.99.Land and Buildings Pushes MGM to Increase Shareholder ValueThe Investor Letter:Shares of MGM Resorts International (NYSE: MGM) spiked higher Tuesday on following announcement by shareholder Land and Buildings, that they had sent a letter to MGM's Board, suggesting potential steps the company could take to enhance shareholder value. Among these, a rumored Wynn Resorts Ltd (NASDAQ: WYNN) and MGM Merger would have "extraordinary synergies and we hope that should a merger be completed MGM would adopt Wynn's commitment to operational excellence and balance sheet discipline." Shares of other casino issues, including Las Vegas Sands Corp. (NYSE: LVS) and Melco Crown Entertainment Limited (NASDAQ: MPEL) also rose following the Land and Buildings release.MGM shares gained almost 4% Tuesday, closing at $18.25, Wynn closed at $98.67, up 5%, LVS shares rose almost 5%, to close at $52.57 and Melco shares gained almost 10%, closing at $19.63.Another Twitter Rumor

Text: Shares of Twitter, Inc. (NYSE: TWTR) surged higher Tuesday on renewed takeover chatter, this time involving Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB). Google (NASDAQ: GOOGL) has also been a rumored suitor for Twitter, while Carl Icahn and Bill Ackman have been mentioned as potential large stakeholders in recent weeks.Spokespersons for Twitter and Facebook did not respond to requests for comment on the rumor.Twitter shares gained almost 6% Tuesday, closing at $36.22.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. K+S later confirmed that Potash informed the Board of Executive Directors and the Supervisory Board of K+S Aktiengesellschaft that Potash may make an offer to the shareholders of K+S to acquire all outstanding shares by way of public takeover offer. Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 24, 2015

Text: Zimmer Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: ZMH) announced Wednesday, that they have completed the acquisition of Biomet in a cash and stock deal currently valued at approximately $14.0 billion, and has changed its corporate name to Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc. The company will begin trading on the NYSE with the ticker symbol 'ZBH' beginning June 29, 2015.Zimmer confirmed the deal completion following the receipt of U.S. FTC clearance.Zimmer Holdings shares closed at $113.52 on Wednesday, up $0.84. Fiat Chrysler CEO Discusses GM Merger ProspectsThe CEO Comments:Fiat Chrysler Automobiles N.V. (NYSE: FCAU) CEO Sergio Marchionne, said Wednesday that his company was a long way from making an offer to General Motors Company (NYSE: GM) shareholders. Marchionne, speaking at an event outside Milan, where the company presented the new Alfa Giulia, would not respond to a question on the possibility of making a hostile bid for GM, according to Reuters. Marchionne said no contact had been made with the US automaker. GM CEO Mary Barra has already rejected the idea of a merger.Fiat Chrysler shares fell 2% Wednesday, closing at $15.47, while GM shares fell 3%, to end the day at $35.16.Proposed Staples, Office Depot Merger in Jeopardy Following Blocking of Sysco US Foods Deal

(NYSE: ODP) is less likely, now that Federal Judge Amit Mehta ruled that the Sysco merger with US Foods is temporarily halted until a full trial is held. US Foods has stated it would not extend the merger agreement in case of a halt.The FTC is expected to rule on the Staples-Office Depot merger in Q4.Staples shares lost 4.5% Wednesday, to close at $15.85, while Office Depot shares fell 2.5%, closing at $8.89.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Thursday June 18, 2015:Lumenis to be Acquired for $14.00/Share, In Cash
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 18, 2015

Text: Lumenis Ltd. (LMNS) announced Thursday that it has agreed to be acquired by XIO Group for $14.00 per share in cash, or approximately $510 million. The deal is expected to close in September 2015. Lumenis shares rose more than 12.75% Thursday, to close at $13.62.Hearing The Deal Says Allergan May Bid for Zeltiq
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 18, 2015

Text: Shares of ZELTIQ Aesthetics, Inc. (NASDAQ: ZLTQ) spiked higher Thursday, on a report from The Deal that it could be a takeover target of Allergan plc (NYSE: AGN), according to The Deal.Spokespersons for Zeltiq and Allergan did not respond to requests for comment.Zeltiq shares gained more than 6% Thursday, to close at $70.15.Sequential Brands Near Deal to Acquire Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 18, 2015

Text: Shares od Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia Inc. (NYSE: MSO) spiked higher, prior to being halted circuit-breaker Thursday, on a report from the Wall Street Journal that the company is close to a sale to Sequential Brands Group Inc. (NASDAQ: SQBG), according to sources. A deal could be announced in the next few days, though the terms of such a deal are not known.Martha Stewart shares gained more than 26% Thursday, closing at $6.44.Cenovus Energy In Exclusive Talks With Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan Regarding Sale of Royalty Lands
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 18, 2015

Text: Shares of Cenovus Energy Inc (NYSE: CVE) spiked higher Thursday, on a report from Reuters the the company is in exclusive talks with the Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan regarding the sale of royalty lands in a deal that could be worth C$2.5 billion to C$3 billion, according to sources.Cenovus and the Ontario Teachers declined comment on the report.Cenovus Energy shares gained more than 4% Thursday, closing at $17.60.SL Industries Announces Non-Binding Acquisition Proposal Receipt From Handy & Harman To Acquire All Outstanding Shares for $43-$45/ShareThe Offer:SL Industries, Inc. (NYSE MKT: SLI) announced Thursday, that its independent Board members have received a non-binding proposal from Handy & Harman Ltd. (NASDAQ: HNH), to acquire all outstanding shares of common stock of SL for $43.00 to $45.00 per share. Handy & Harman, affiliate of Steel Partners Holdings L.P., owns 25.3% of SL's outstanding common stock. SL stockholders would be able to elect to receive cash or Handy & Harman stock , subject to proration so that the aggregate consideration consists of 55% cash and 45% Handy & Harman stock.SL's Board has established a Special Committee to evaluate the proposal.Shares of SL Industries closed at $40.51 on Thursday and traded at $41.70, after-hours.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Wednesday June 17, 2015:Allergan to Acquire Kythera Biopharma for $75/Share
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 17, 2015

Text: Allergan plc (NYSE: AGN) and KYTHERA Biopharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ: KYTH) announced Wednesday, that Allergan has agreed to acquire KYTHERA for $75.00 per share in cash and stock, or approximately $2.1 billion. Allergan currently anticipates closing the transaction in the third quarter of 2015.Kythera shares rose 22% Wednesday, to close at $74.10.Qihoo 360 Reports Receipt of Preliminary Non-Binding Offer to Purchase Co. for $77/ADSThe Going Private Offer:Qihoo 360 Technology Co. Ltd. (NASDAQ: QIHU) announced Wednesday, that its Board) has received a preliminary non-binding proposal letter, dated June 17, 2015, from Hongyi Zhou, chairman and CEO, CITIC Securities Co. Ltd. or its affiliates, Golden Brick Capital Private Equity Fund I L.P., China Renaissance Holdings Limited or its affiliates and Sequoia Capital China I, L.P. and/or its affiliates, to acquire all of the outstanding Class A and Class B ordinary shares of the Company not owned by them or their affiliates, including Class A ordinary shares represented by American Depositary Shares, for $77.00 in cash per ADS.The Board will form a special committee to consider the proposal.Qihoo 360 shares gained more than 6% Wednesday, to close at $70.15.Hill-Rom Acquires Welch Allyn for $2.05B in Cash, Stock
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 17, 2015

Text: Hill-Rom Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: HRC) and Welch Allyn, Inc. announced Wednesday, that the Boards of Directors of both companies have unanimously approved a definitive agreement under which Hill-Rom will acquire Welch Allyn for approximately $2.05 billion in cash and stock. Welch Allyn shareholders will receive $1.625 billion in cash and approximately 8.1 million newly-issued shares of Hill-Rom common stock.The transaction is to be completed by the end of September 2015.Hill-Rom shares gained more than 6% Wednesday, closing at $55.70.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter of Microsoft Bid for Salesforce
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 17, 2015

Text: Shares of salesforce.com, inc. (NYSE: CRM) rose Wednesday, on unconfirmed market chatter of a $90 per share offer from Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT).There have been reports since April of potential offers from Microsoft and Oracle Corporation (ORCL).CNBC's David Faber reported on May 22, that Salesforce CEO Benioff and Microsoft CEO Nadella had held significant talks, but could not agree on price. Spokespersons for Salesforce and Microsoft did not respond to requests for comment on today's rumor.Salesforce shares gained more than 1% Wednesday, closing at $74.42.Comcast Not Interested in T-Mobile Deal
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 17, 2015

Text: Comcast Corp. (NYSE: CMCSA) is not interested in acquiring T-Mobile US Inc. (NYSE: TMUS), according to Bloomberg. A source says T-Mobile has not discussed a potential deal with with its parent company Deutsche Telekom AG (OTC: DTEGY), while Comcast doesn't want to pursue another deal so soon after its failed bid for Time Warner Cable (NYSE: TWC) and once again attract the attention of regulators.Shares of T-Mobile gained more than 2% Wednesday, closing at $39.77.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Tuesday June 16, 2015:Blackstone, Carlyle Group in Joint Bid to Acquire NCR for $10B Including Debt
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 16, 2015

Text: Blackstone Group LP (NYSE: BX) and Carlyle Group LP (NASDAQ: CG) are said to be preparing a joint offer for NCR Corp (NYSE: NCR), in an LBO valued at more than $10 billion, including debt, according to sources reported by Reuters. Apollo Global Management LLC (NYSE: APO) Thoma Bravo LLC are reportedly also considering offers for the manufacturer of cash registers.Activist Jana Partners took an initial stake of 7.1% in February. In April it was reported the company was exploring strategic options.Spokespersons for NCR, Carlyle and Blackstone did not respond to requests for comment.NCR shares rose 10.71% Tuesday, to close at $34.73.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter of Potential Merck Bid for Alkermes
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 16, 2015

Text: Shares of Alkermes plc (NASDAQ: ALKS) spiked higher Tuesday on unconfirmed market chatter of a potential bid from Merck (NYSE: MRK). The offer is said to be $12.4 billion, according to sources.Alkermes declined comment on the rumor. Merck did not respond to request for comment.Alkermes shares gained 10% Tuesday, to close at $64.52.Metalico Agrees to Sell Company to Total Merchant for $105M
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 16, 2015

Text: The Board of Directors of Metalico, Inc. (NYSE MKT: MEA) has agreed to sell the Company to Total Merchant Limited for approximately $105 million in cash, including a payment to Metalico's stockholders of $0.60 for each share of Metalico common stock owned by them as of the date of closing.The deal is expected to close in Q3 of 2015.Metalico shares gained 48% Tuesday, closing at $0.55Details of Coty Acquisition of P&G Beauty Business to be Finalized in 2 Weeks
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 16, 2015

Text: Shares of Coty Inc. (NYSE: COTY) rose to all-time highs on Tuesday, on a report from Reuters that its acquisition of P&G's (NYSE: PG) beauty business for $12 billion may be finalized in two weeks or more, according to sources. The transaction would be completed through a Reverse Morris trust, for tax purposes.The NY Post reported on Monday, that Coty had acquired P&G's beauty products business for $12 billion.Coty shares gained more than 19% Tuesday, closing at $31.08.Cinedigm May be Attracting Bids from Multiple Suitors
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 16, 2015

Text: Shares of Cinedigm Corp. (NASDAQ: CIDM) Spiked higher Tuesday, on a report from Bloomberg that they have hired Evolution Media Capital to assist in handling potential offers, according to sources. Cinedigm is said to have received interest from both domestic and international entertainment companies looking to bolster their digital strategies or to gain a public stock listing, said one of the people, with at least two of the companies submitting an offer.Relativity Media is said to be one of the companies showing an interest.Shares of Cinedigm gained 4.5% Tuesday, closing at $0.92.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Monday June 15, 2015:CVS to Acquire Target's Pharmacy Business for $1.9B
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 15, 2015

Text: CVS Health Corporation (NYSE: CVS) and Target Corporation (NYSE: TGT) announced Monday, that they have entered into a definitive agreement for CVS to acquire Target's pharmacy and clinic businesses for approximately $1.9 billion. The agreement includes Target's more than 1,660 pharmacies in 47 states, as well as all new Target stores that offer pharmacy services. The pharmacies will be operated in a store-within-a-store format, to be branded as CVS/pharmacy.Timing of the deal closing is uncertain, but may occur by the end of of 2015.Target shares rose more than 1% Monday, to close at $80.45, while CVS shares rose $0.36, closing at $102.58.Niska Gas Storage Partners to Be Acquired by Brookfield Infrastructure for $4.225/Common Unit in Cash
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 15, 2015

Text: Niska Gas Storage Partners LLC (NYSE: NKA) announced Monday that it and its managing member, Niska Gas Storage Management LLC, have entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by Brookfield Infrastructure (NYSE: BIP) and its institutional partners for $4.225 per common unit in cash. The deal is valued at approximately $911.9 million, including the assumption of debt. The deal is expected to close in H2 of 2016.Niska Gas Storage Partners shares gained 203% Monday, to close at $3.974.iDreamSky Receives Preliminary Non-Binding Proposal of $14.00/ADS in CashThe Offer: iDreamSky Technology Limited (NASDAQ: DSKY) announced Monday, that its board of directors has received a preliminary non-binding proposal letter, dated June 13, 2015, from Michael Xiangyu Chen, Chairman and CEO, to acquire all the outstanding Class A and Class B ordinary shares of the company not owned by him or his affiliates, for $14.00 per ADS in cash.The Board has formed a special committee consisting of independent directors (the "Special Committee") to consider the proposal. The Board expects that the Special Committee will retain independent advisors, including independent financial and legal advisors, to assist it in this process.iDreamSky shares lost almost 10% Monday, closing at $13.13.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter of Potential Google Bid for Zillow
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 15, 2015

Text: Shares of Zillow (NYSE: Z) spiked higher Monday, on unconfirmed market chatter of a potential offer from Google (NASDAQ: GOOGL). Google is said to be considering an offer of $120 to $135 per share for Zillow and has plans to integrate the house listings onto Google Maps.Spokespersons for Zillow and Google were not available for comment.Zillow shares gained $0.25 Monday, closing at $86.33Report Kandi Technologies Could be Next 'Going Private' Target
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 15, 2015

Text: Shares of Kandi Technologies (NASDAQ: KNDI) rose early Monday on a report from Deal Reporter that the electric vehicle maker could be the next Chinese company in line for a "going private" proposal.A spokesperson for Kandi was not immediately available for comment.Shares of Kandi Technologies lost 3.72% Monday, closing at $10.10.Healthcare Stocks Volatile on Multiple Reports of Takeover Interest
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 15, 2015

Text: Shares of Cigna Corp. (NYSE: CI) spiked higher Monday on a report from the Wall Street Journal that Anthem Inc. (NYSE: ANTM) has offered as much as $175 per share for the Bloomfield, CT- based healthcare company. Cigna reportedly rejected that offer and an earlier one, according to sources.Shares of Humana Inc. (NYSE: HUM), which had been rumored late last month to have received approaches from Cigna and Aetna Inc. (NYSE: AET), fell sharply, after initially spiking higher.Later, the Wall Street Journal reported that UnitedHealth Group Inc. (NYSE: UNH) had it sights set on Cigna and Aetna, while a deal with Humana could raise regulatory issues.Shares of Cigna gained 11.74% Monday, closing at $153.43, Aetna gained 4.5% to close at $121.01 and Humana lost 2.77%, closing at $206.58.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter Axiall May Explore Sale
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 15, 2015

Text: Shares of Axiall Corp (NASDAQ: AXLL) spiked higher Monday on unconfirmed market chatter the company may consider strategic options, which include a potential sale.Axiall responded to the rumor in a note to Benzinga: "Axiall has demonstrated a practice of maintaining an open dialogue with its shareholders, including Shapiro Capital Management, and we welcome the input of all shareholders. Our board of directors and executive management team regularly reviews Axiall's strategic plans and priorities, and are always open to receiving constructive input towards our shared goal of increasing long-term value for all of the Company's stakeholders."Axiall shares gained 5.5% Monday, closing at $39.66.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 15, 2015

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Friday June 12 to June 14, 2015:Bona Film Group Recieves Preliminary "Going Private" Proposal Of $13.70/ADS
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Bona Film Group Limited (NASDAQ: BONA) announced Friday, that its Board of Directors has received a non-binding proposal of a "going private" transaction, dated June 12, 2015, from founder, Chairman and CEO Yu Dong, Sequoia Capital China I LP and Fosun International Limited. The buyer group proposes to acquire all of the outstanding ordinary shares of the company not already owned by the buyer group for $13.70 in cash per ADS.The Board intends to form a special committee to consider the proposal.Bona Film Group shares gained 1% Friday, to close at $12.99.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter of Potential Oracle Bid for Splunk
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Shares of Splunk, Inc. (NASDAQ: SPLK) rose Friday, on unconfirmed market chatter of a potential bid from Oracle Corporation (NYSE: ORCL). Sources say the offer could be in the upper $70s per shareSpokespersons for Oracle and Splunk were not available for comment.Splunk shares lost $0.25 Friday, closing at $68.92.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter of Potential Home Depot Bid for Lumber Liquidators
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Shares of Lumber Liquidators Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: LL) spiked higher Friday, on unconfirmed market chatter of a potential offer from The Home Depot, Inc. (NYSE: HD). According to the report, Home Depot could pay $35 to $40 per share.Spokespersons for Lumber Liquidators declined comment, when questioned by Benzinga about the report. Whitney Tilson, who has been short Lumber Liquidators since 2013, said the rumor is the dumbest ever. Tilson also said no one would buy the company.Lumber Liquidators shares gained 4% Friday, closing at $21.49.GoGo Reportedly in Talks With Verizon, AT&T
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Shares of Gogo (NASDAQ: GOGO) spiked higher twice Friday on unconfirmed market chatter that the company has been in talks with both Verizon (NYSE: VZ) and AT&T (NYSE: T) regarding a potential deal. According to the report, Gogo has hired Goldman Sachs to handle bids, which are said to have been as high as $35 per share.Neither Gogo, Verizon or AT&T responded to requests for comment.Shares of Gogo gained $0.12 Friday, closing at $22.08.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Thursday June 11, 2015:HealthSouth to Acquire Operations of Reliant Hospital Partners for $730M
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 11, 2015

Text: HealthSouth Corporation (NYSE: HLS) announced Thursday. it has entered into an agreement to acquire the operations of Reliant Hospital Partners, LLC and affiliates for $730 million in cash. The deal was approved by both companies' boards of directors and is expected to close in 2015. HealthSouth shares gained 9.5% Thursday, to close at $47.41.Hess to Sell 50% Interest in Bakken Midstream Assets for $2.675B
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 11, 2015

Text: Hess Corporation (NYSE: HES) announced Thursday, that it has agreed to sell a 50% stake in its Bakken midstream assets to Global Infrastructure Partners for $2.675 billion in cash, creating a joint venture. The joint venture will pursue a proposed initial public offering.The deal is expected to close in Q3 2015.Hess shares rose 36% Thursday, closing at $77.35.Homeinn Receives "Going Private" Offer Of $32.81/ADSThe Going Private Offer:Homeinns Hotel Group (NASDAQ: HMIN) announced Thursday, that its Board of Directors has received a non-binding proposal letter, dated June 11, 2015, from BTG Hotels, Poly Victory Investments Limited, Ctrip.com International, Ltd., Neil Nanpeng Shen, Co-Founder and Co-Chairman of the Board of the company, James Jianzhang Liang, Co-Founder and Director and Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO of Ctrip.com International Ltd. (NASDAQ: CTRP), and David Jian Sun, CEO and Director of the company, proposing a "going-private" transaction to acquire all of the outstanding ordinary shares of Homeinns not already owned by the Buyer Group for $32.81 per ADS in cash.Homeinns shares gained almost 4% Thursday, closing at $31.35.Report Dish in Talks With Banks About Funding for T-Mobile US Bid
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 11, 2015

Text: Shares of Dish Network (NASDAQ: DISH) and T-Mobile US (NYSE: TMUS) spiked higher after-hours on Thursday, on a report from the Wall Street Journal that Dish has been speaking with banks in order to line-up $10 billion to $15 billion in funding for a potential deal, according to sources.Reports first surfaced on June 4, that the two companies were in merger talks.Shares of T-Mobile US ended the regular session at $38.12 on Thursday, and traded over $40.00 after-hours. Dish shares closed at $72.79 and traded over $74.00 in the extended session. Posted-In: News Rumors Management M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 10, 2015

(NYSE: HCC) announced Wednesday, that they have entered an agreement under which Tokio Marine will acquire all outstanding shares of HCC, for $78.00 per share in cash, via TMHD's wholly owned subsidiary, Tokio Marine & Nichido Fire Insurance Co., Ltd. Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 10, 2015

Text: Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) has acquired BlueStripe Software, a leading provider of application management technology. The acquisition was announced on the Bluestrip website.Terms were not disclosed.Microsoft shares gained 2% Wednesday, closing at $46.61.Ares in Talks to Acquire Kayne Anderson
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Wednesday June 10, 2015

The talks are ongoing, but no deal has been reached yet, according to the sources. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Tuesday June 9, 2015:Rumor of Jack Ma/Wasu Stake in Netflix
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 9, 2015

Text: Shares of Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NASDAQ) surged higher Tuesday, and never stopped, following an unconfirmed report that Jack Ma and Wasu Media were preparing to take a 20% stake in the movie streaming company. Shares hit an all-time high over the $648 level.Spokespersons for Netflix and Wasu Media were not available for comment on the report. Today is also the Netflix annual shareholder meeting. Netflix shares gained more than 3% Tuesday, to close at $647.15, and rose another $4.00 after-hours.Rumor Receptos Rejected $200/Share AstraZeneca Bid
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 9, 2015

Text: Shares of Receptos (NASDAQ: RCPT) spiked higher Tuesday, on a report from Proactiv Investors that Receptos rejected a $200 bid from AstraZeneca (NYSE: AZN), while Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (NASDAQ: TEVA) and Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ: GILD) reportedly offered $280. The article states Receptos is willing to accept an offer of $350 per share.Spokepersons for Receptos, AstraZeneca and Proactive Investors did not return calls.Receptos shares 2.5% Tuesday, closing at $160.44.China Mobile Games to be Purchased by Pegasus Investment for $22.00/ADS
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 9, 2015

Text: China Mobile Games and Entertainment Group Limited (NYSE: CMGE)announced Tuesday, that it has entered into a definitive agreement and plan of merger with Pegasus Investment Holdings Limited and Pegasus Merger Sub Limited, under which Pegasus will acquire CMGE for $22.00 per ADS.China Mobile Games Board unanimously approved the merger agreement. China Mobile Games shares gained more than 5% Tuesday, closing at $21.09.Hearing Unconfirmed Market Chatter of Potential Unilever Bid for Colgate-Palmolive
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 9, 2015

Text: Shares of Colgate-Palmolive Co. (NYSE: CL) Tuesday, on unconfirmed market chatter that Unilever plc (NYSE: UL) is preparing a bid for the maker of Colgate Toothpaste and Palmolive dish soap. The premium would reportedly more than 20%, according to a source.Spokespersons for Colgate-Palmolive and Unilever did not respond to requests for comment.Colgate-Palmolive shares gained 1% Tuesday, closing at $66.03. Diebold in Talks to Acquire Wincor Nixdorf
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday June 9, 2015

Text: Shares of Diebold (NYSE: DBD) spiked higher Tuesday, on a report from Reuters that it is in talks to acquire German rival Wincor Nixdorf (OTC: WNXDY), according to sources. Wincor reportedly has hired Goldman Sachs as an advisor, while Diebold is said to be working with JP Morgan.A Diebold spokesperson declined comment, while a Wincor Nixdorf spokesperson was not available.Diebold shares gained more than 7% Tuesday, closing at $37.83. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Monday June 8, 2015:Rumor Circulating of Merck Bid for Celgene
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 8, 2015

Text: Shares of Celgene Corporation (NASDAQ: CELG) spiked higher, Monday, on unconfirmed market chatter of a potential bid from Merck & Co (NYSE: MRK). The rumored offer is between $131 and $133, according to sources. Celgene had a market cap of $88 billion, following the rumor, while Merck's cap is about double that.Spokespersons for Celgene and Merck did not respond to requests for comment.Celgene shares gained $0.29 Monday, to close at $$111.01.Cypress Fails to Finalize Merger Agreement with ISSIThe Failed Merger:Integrated Silicon Solution, Inc. (NASDAQ: ISSI) announced Monday, that Cypress Semiconductor (NASDAQ: CY) has failed to finalize a merger agreement by the deadline of June 7, 2015 imposed by Cypress. ISSI says Cypress received the negotiated draft agreement from ISSI on Friday, June 5, 2015. Despite the merger agreement being nearly fully negotiated, ISSI believes a transaction with Cypress presents significant antitrust risks in the U.S. and Germany. Cypress offered to acquire ISSI for $20.25 per share on May 15.Integrated Silicon Solution shares fell $0.38 Monday, closing at $20.35.Jiayuan.com Receives Amended 'Going Private' Proposal of $7.20/ADSThe Going Private Proposal:Jiayuan.com International Ltd. (NASDAQ: DATE) announced Monday, that the special committee of the company's board of directors, has an amended 'going private' proposal from Vast Profit of $7.20 per ADS, which is an increase from their previous offer of $5.37 per ADS.The special committee said it is evaluating this and other proposals it has received, and that no decisions have been made.Jiayuan.com shares lost 5.5% Monday, closing at $7.39Report Atmel Considering Options Including Potential Sale
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday June 8, 2015

Text: Shares of Atmel (NASDAQ: ATML) soared late Monday, on a report from Reuters, that the maker of microcontrollers is exploring a potential sale of the company, along with other strategic alternatives, according to sources. Atmel is reportedly working with Qatalyst Partners as an advisor on the possible sale.Spokespersons for Atmel and Qatalyst did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment.There was unusual activity reported by Benzinga in the Atmel November $11 call last week. That call trade up 87% immediately following the Reuters report.Atmel shares gained 3.5% Monday, closing at $9.75. Sungy Mobile Enters into Agreement for 'Going Private' Transaction of $4.90/ADSThe Going Private Transaction:Sungy Mobile Limited (NASDAQ: GOMO) announced Monday, that it has entered into an agreement and plan of merger with Sunflower Parent Limited, IDG, CBC Mobile Venture Limited and Sunflower Merger Sub Limited. Under the agreement, at the effective time of the merger, each of the Co's class A ordinary shares and class B ordinary shares issued and outstanding immediately prior to the effective time of the Merger will be cancelled and cease to exist in exchange for the right to receive US$0.81667 in cash without interest, and each American Depositary Share of the Company, which represents six class A ordinary shares, will be cancelled in exchange for the right to receive $4.90 in cash without interestSungy Mobile shares lost more than 3% Monday, closing at $4.61. Syngenta Rejects Latest Monsanto Proposal, Including $2B Reverse Break-up FeeThe Rejection:Syngenta (NYSE: SYT) confirmed Monday, that it received a second letter from Monsanto (NYSE: MON) which essentially repeated their first proposal of April 18 of CHF449 in cash. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Friday June 5, through Sunday June 7, 2015:Shire Considers $18.32B Takeover of Actelion
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Shire plc (NASDAQ: SHPG) has approached Swiss drug company Actelion Ltd (OTC: ALIOF) regarding a potential £12 billion buyout, according to sources as reported by the UK's Sunday Times. The contact was made several weeks ago, according to the sources. Shire is said to have discussed an offer of CHF160 per share for Actelion, a premium of 21% over Friday's closing price. Shire declined comment on the report. An Actelion spokesperson was not immediately available for comment.Shire shares lost $0.26 Friday, to close at $251.51.JA Solar Receives 'Going Private' Proposal of $9.69/ADSThe Offer: JA Solar Holdings Co., Ltd. (NASDAQ: JASO) announced Friday, that its Board has received a preliminary "going private" proposal from Chairman and CEO Baofang Jin and Jinglong Group Co., Ltd., to acquire all of the outstanding shares of JASO not already owned by the buyer group, for $9.69 per ADS (each ADS represents five ordinary shares) ($1.938 per ordinary share) in cash, subject to conditions.The Board will form a special committee to consider the proposal. JA Solar shares rose more than 12% Friday, closing at $9.07.Cardinal Health to Acquire The Harvard Drug Group for ~$1.115B
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) announced Friday, plans to acquire The Harvard Drug Group for $1.115 billion using existing cash and new debt. The deal is expected to close in the beginning of FY 2016. Cardinal Health shares gained $0.43 Friday, closing at $88.04. Report Brazilian Billionaire May Bid for Diageo
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Shares of Diageo plc (NYSE: DEO) soared late Friday, on a report from Bloomberg, that Brazilian billionaire Jorge Paulo Lemann is considering a bid for the UK-based liquor manufacturer. Lemann runs 3G Captital, which together with Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway, acquired H.J. Heinz in 2013, and arranged a deal to merge it with Kraft Foods Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: KRFT) this year.Diageo shares gained 8% Friday, closing at $118.00. GE Near Deal to Sell PE Lending Unit to Canada Pension Plan Investment Board
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: General Electric (NYSE: GE) is near a deal to sell its private-equity lending unit to Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, according to the Wall Street Journal. The deal reportedly will include more than $10 billion of assets, but less than $16 billion, according to sources. The report says it is possible the deal could still fall apart.GE shares gained $0.03 Friday, closing at $27.29. Monsanto Adds $2B Reverse Break-up Fee to OfferThe Offer:Monsanto Company (NYSE: MON) on Sunday, reaffirmed its CHF449 cash and stock offer for Syngenta (NYSE: SYT) and added a new $2 billion reverse break-up fee payable by Monsanto if it is unable to obtain necessary global regulatory approvals. Syngenta announced on May 8, it had rejected Monsanto's same CHF449 bid.Syngenta shares lost 1.5% Friday, closing at $88.33, while Monsanto gained $0.22, to end the day at $113.80. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Thursday June 4, 2015:Opko Health to Acquire Bio-Reference Laboratories in All-Stock Transaction
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 4, 2015

Text: Opko Health, Inc. (NYSE: OPK) and Bio-Reference Laboratories, Inc. (NNASDAQ: BRLI) announced Thursday, that Opko will acquire Bio-Reference Laboratories. Under the terms of the agreement, BRLI common stock will receive 2.75 shares of OPKO common stock for each share of BRLI common stock, valued at $52.58 per share of BRLI common stock. The deal is expected to be completed during H2 of 2015. Bio-Reference Laboratories shares rose 20% Thursday, to close at $39.60, while Opko shares lost 15% to close at $16.47.T-Mobile, Dish Network In Merger Talks
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday June 4, 2015

Text: Shares of T-Mobile US (NYSE: IBM) traded as high as $43.25 Thursday, while shares of Dish Network (NASDAQ: DISH) traded at $76.50, following a Wall Street Journal report Wednesday, that the two companies were in merger talks, according to sources. Dish CEO Charlie Ergen would reportedly become the chairman of the combined company, with T-Moblie CEO John Legere becoming the CEO of the new entity.According to the sources, the purchase price remains an unresolved issue and could be weeks away. Fox Business' Charlie Gasparino said his sources say the deal could be announced in the next two weeks.T-Mobile shares rose 2.5% Thursday, closing at $39.34, while Dish shares rose almost 5%, closing at $74.25. GigOptix Announces Renewal of Interest in Purchasing GSI Tech at $6.50/ShareThe Offer:GigOptix, Inc. (NYSE MKT: GIG) announced Thursday, that it sent a letter to the board of directors of GSI Technology, Inc. (Nasdaq: GSIT), proposing to acquire all of the outstanding shares of GSI Technology's common stock for $6.50 per share. GigOptix would acquire all of the outstanding shares of GSI Technology common stock for $6.50, consisting of a not yet determined combination of cash, shares of GigOptix and a special cash dividend payable by GSI Technology. GigOptix anticipates the cash consideration can exceed $6.00 per share.GigOptix expects the proposed transaction would be completed by the end of 2015. GSI Technology shares rose almost 3% Thursday, closing at $5.41. GSI Technology shares fell 5.7%, to close at $1.49.Posted-In: News Rumors M&A© 2015 Benzinga.com. (NASDAQ: CTRP) announced Wednesday, that it is no longer interested in pursuing talks for a potential deal with Qunar Cayman Islands Limited (NASDAQ: QUNR), based on Qunar's recent earnings report and corporate actions. Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday May 28, 2015

Text: Shares of Tesla Motors, Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) rose Thursday on unconfirmed market chatter of a potential bid from Google Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOGL), according to sources. The offer is rumored to be in the range of $280 to $300 per share.Global Equities Research analyst Trip Chowdhry told Benzinga he didn't think such a deal was possible, though a strong partnership was more likely and already exists. Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday May 28, 2015

Text: Avago Technologies Limited (NASDAQ: AVGO) and Broadcom Corporation (NASDAQ: BRCM) announced Thursday, that Avago will acquire Broadcom for $17 billion in cash consideration and the economic equivalent of approximately 140 million Avago ordinary shares, valued at $20 billion as of May 27, 2015. Broadcom shareholders will have the ability to elect to receive, for each Broadcom share held: (i) $54.50 in cash; (ii) 0.4378 ordinary shares in a newly-formed Singapore holding company; (iii) a restricted equity security that is the economic equivalent of 0.4378 ordinary shares of HoldCo that will not be transferable or saleable for a period of one to two years after closing; or (iv) a combination thereof.The deal is expected to close by the end of Q1 of 2016.Broadcom shares fell 1.78% Thursday, closing at $56.14. Avago shares rose $0.89 to close at $142.38.Unconfirmed Market Chatter 3D Systems has Hired Goldman Sachs to Handle Potential Bid from GEThe rumor:Shares of 3D Systems Corporation (NYSE: DDD) rose Thursday on unconfirmed market chatter the company had hired Goldman Sachs in order to assist in handling a potential offer from General Electric Company (NYSE: GE). Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Thursday May 28, 2015

Spokespersons for Nike and Skechers did not respond to requests for comment.Skechers shares rose $3.01, closing at $106.86, while Nike shares fell $0.26, to close at $102.30.Twitter CEO Says Co Not Being Shopped AroundThe Interview:Twitter, Inc. (NYSE: TWTR) CEO Dick Costolo, speaking at Re/code's annual Code Conference in Rancho Palos Verdes, CA, said he is not shopping his company around. Rumors of potential buyers have been rampant for years, along with rumors that Costolo would be ousted as CEO. Costolo stated "We have every intention of being an independent company. Those things you read about in the press are simply rumors, not facts."Twitter shares rose $0.42 Thursday, closing at $36.83.Monsanto Could be Ready to Raise Bid for Syngenta

Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Tuesday May 26, 2015

Text: Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ: CHTR) and Time Warner Cable Inc. (NYSE: TWC) announced Tuesday, that they have reached an agreement for Charter to merge with Time Warner Cable in a deal that values Time Warner Cable at $78.7 billion. Charter will pay $100.00 in cash and shares of a new public parent company equivalent to 0.5409 shares of Charter for each Time Warner Cable share outstanding. Each Time Warner Cable share is valued at approximately $195.71 based on Charter's market closing price on May 20. Time Warner Cable shareholders, other than Liberty Broadband or Liberty Interactive may elect to receive $115.00 of cash and New Charter shares equivalent to 0.4562 shares of Charter for each Time Warner Cable share they own.Charter also announced that Charter will acquire Bright House Networks for $10.4 billion. Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Monday May 18, 2015:Ascena Retail to Acquire ANN Inc. for $47/Share in Cash, Stock
Article Header: Benzinga's M&A Chatter for Monday May 18, 2015

Text: Ascena Retail Group, Inc. (NASDAQ" ASNA) and ANN Inc. (NYSE: ANN) announced Monday, that Ascena will acquire ANN INC. for $37.34 in cash plus 0.68 of a share of Ascena common stock in exchange for each share of ANN common stock. That implies a price per share of $47.00, based upon the closing price of Ascena stock on May 15, 2015.The transaction is expected to close in H2 of 2015. Non-Binding Offer from Orient Hongtai Investment Mgmt Co. to Purchase Co. at $1.5357/Share in Cash, $21.50/ADSThe Offer:China Mobile Games and Entertainment Group (NASDAQ: CMGE) announced Monday, that its Board of Directors has received a preliminary non-binding proposal from Orient Hongtai Investment Management Co., Ltd. to acquire all of the outstanding shares of the company, including ordinary shares represented by ADS's, for $1.5357 in cash per Class A or Class B ordinary share, or $21.5 in cash per ADS. CMGE has retained Kirkland & Ellis to act as its U.S. counsel and expects to engage a financial advisor to assist it in its review and evaluation of the proposal.CMGE shares gained $0.17 Monday, closing at $20.55.Ming Yang Acquires Renergy for $149M

Text: China Ming Yang Wind Power Group (NYSE: MY) announced Monday that it has entered into share purchase agreements to acquire a 99% stake in China Smart Electric Group Limited, which owns all of the equity interest in Wise Renergy Holdings Limited, which owns all of the equity interests in Tianjin REnergy Electrical Co., Ltd. and Tianjin Ruiyuan Electrical Co., Ltd. Ming Yang will pay $149 million in cash and newly issued shares in Ming Yang. Ming Yang closed Monday at $3.52, a gain of $0.03Intel, Altera Resume Takeover Talks, According to Sources

Text: The following are the M&A deals, rumors and chatter circulating on Wall Street for Friday May 15 through Sunday May 17, 2015:Rumor of Interest from Microsoft in BlackBerry
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Shares of BlackBerry (NASDAQ: BBRY) spiked higher Friday, on a post from Betaville that Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) could be considering buying the Canadian smartphone maker for as much as $7 billion. Microsoft has reportedly hired Deutsche Bank and Goldman Sachs to investigate deal, Microsoft declined comment.BlackBerry shares rose $0.01 on Friday, to close at $10.33.Sorrento Therapeutics Announces Sale of Cynviloq for Up to $1.3B
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Sorrento Therapeutics, Inc. (NASDAQ: SRNE) announced Friday, that NantPharma, has agreed to acquire the rights to Cynviloq through the acquisition of Sorrento Subsidiary Igdrasol. Sorrento will receive more than $90 million in an up-front cash payment, plus up to $600 million in regulatory and $600 million in sales milestone payments. Sorrento has the option to co-develop, co-market Cynviloq on terms to be negotiated.Sorrento Therapeutics shares gained 13% Friday, closing at $13.01.FBI Investigating PTG Capital $18.75/Share Offer for Avon
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: The FBI is investigating what may be a bogus takeover bid for Avon Products Inc. (NYSE: AVP) filed on Thursday, according to the Wall Street Journal. Avon shares were halted three times on circuit-breakers, as "PTG Capital Partners" filed to offer $18.75 per share for the cosmetics company. Avon says it did not receive an offer from PTG and believed the offer to be a hoax. The SEC is also reportedly investigating the matter.Avon shares lost 1.5% Friday, to close at $7.05.Axis Reportedly Won't Raise Offer for PartnerRe
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Axis Capital Holdings won't raise its offer for PartnerRe (NYSE: PRE) and believes its proposal of $132 per share in stock, plus a special dividend of $11.50 per share, is superior to the $137.50 all-cash offer from Italy's Exor Spa (OTC: EXOSF), according to sources as reported by Reuters on Sunday. Spokespersons for Axis and PartnerRe declined comment.Exor is PartnerRe's largest shareholder, with a 9.32% stake.PartnerRe closed Friday at $134.23, a gain of $0.14.Apple Acquires Coherent Navigation
Article Header: Benzinga's Weekend M&A Chatter

Text: Apple, Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) has acquired GPS startup Coherent Navigation. The company's LinkedIn page stated: "Coherent Navigation has ceased operations at this time."Terms were not disclosed.Apple closed Friday at $128.77, a loss of $0.18.Posted-In: News Rumors Asset Sales M&A Movers© 2015 Benzinga.com. Benzinga does not provide investment advice. All rights reserved.

QIWI will issue 5,593,041 class B shares to Otkritie in exchange for all of the outstanding interests in Contact and Rapida.
